problem_text:
Describe the hereditarily just infinite pro-p-groups of finite width.
Definitions: A pro-p-group G has finite width p^d if |γ_i(G)/γ_{i+1}(G)| ⩽ p^d for all i,
and G is hereditarily just infinite if G is infinite and each of its open subgroups has
no closed normal subgroups of infinite index.
C. R. Leedham-Green
